t: Job 38
Then*p the Lord*s answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
Who*p is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
Gird*p up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
Where*p wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.
Who*p hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
Whereupon*p are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;
When*p the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
Or*p who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?
When*p I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,
And*p brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,
And*p said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
Hast*p thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;
That*p it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
It*p is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.
And*p from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.
Hast*p thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
Have*p the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
Hast*p thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.
Where*p is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
That*p thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?
Knowest*p thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?
Hast*p thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
Which*p I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
By*p what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?
Who*p hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;
To*p cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
To*p satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
Hath*p the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
Out*p of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
The*p waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
Canst*p thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
Canst*p thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
Knowest*p thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?
Canst*p thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
Canst*p thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?
Who*p hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?
Who*p can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
When*p the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
Wilt*p thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,
When*p they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?
Who*p provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
